title: 50 supporters of MP Chandrashekhar Azad arrested for vandalism
content: The angry supporters of the MP, who was stopped by police while on his way to meet the family of a person who died of burn injuries at Isota village in Prayagraj, had created a ruckus and damaged two police vehicles

title: Jharkhand CM, Governor pay tributes to tribal warriors of Santhal rebellion on 'Hul Diwas'
content: Hul Diwas is observed to commemorate the anniversary of Santhal rebellion against British rule in 1855-56.

title: Uttar Pradesh's Hapur city faces severe waterlogging after heavy rainfall
content: The IMD issues red alert for multiple districts in Himachal Pradesh, as the State continued to experience heavy rainfall, particularly in Mandi, resulting in flooding of the Beas River.

title: Ample Parks launches industrial and logistics park in Chennai
content: Spanning approximately 71 acres, Ample Parks offers around 2.1 million square feet of area for leasing

title: Three wagons of goods train derail in Odisha's Cuttack, none injured
content: A relief train with machines, material and manpower has already been mobilised and the loop line in the yard will be restored soon

title: Maintenance, repair details of grounded UK F-35B fighter jet in Kerala to be kept under wraps
content: But sources close to UK government exude confidence that fighter jet will be brought back to active service of Royal Air Force once maintenance and repair are completed in Thiruvananthapuram airport along with mandatory safety checks

title: India monsoon LIVE: Light rains in Delhi, NCR; heavy rains forecast for some districts in Himachal Pradesh
content: Educational institutions in the Sub Divisions of Manali and Banjar in Kullu, Himachal Pradesh, will remain closed today following a rain alert; 24-hour ban on Char Dham lifted, Uttarakhand officials said

title: What’s changing in Indian railways from July 1: Here’s everything you need to know
content: Key changes include raising AC-class waiting lists, advancing chart publication, enforcing Aadhaar-based verification for Tatkal bookings, and executing a modest fare revision.

title: Indian Navy’s ‘INS Tabar’ leads rescue operation after major fire breaks out in Oman-bound vessel
content: ‘INS Tabar’ responds to distress call from Pulau-flagged ‘MT Yi Cheng 6’; rescue operations are on with the intensity of fire onboard reduced drastically

title: Ravada A. Chandrasekhar is new Kerala State Police Chief
content: A 1991-batch officer of Kerala cadre, Ravada A. Chandrasekhar currently serves as Special Director in Intelligence Bureau. He has been asked to return to Kerala from New Delhi to assume charge at the earliest

title: Ex-MLC Ramchander Rao all set to be Telangana BJP chief
content: The election of State BJP President has been long pending since the last [2023] Assembly elections in Telangana

title: Three Tirumala pilgrims from Karnataka killed in road accident in A.P.
content: According to the Kurabalakota police, the deceased and injured hailed from Bagepalli in Karnataka and were on their return journey from Tirumala; 11 others injured

title: Uttarakhand cloudburst: 24-hour ban on Char Dham lifted; Barkot-Yamunotri road restored
content: Seven workers are still missing, for whom the search is being conducted by NDRF, SDRF, Police, and Revenue teams

title: Srisailam temple EO dismisses reports of cockroach in ‘laddu prasadam’
content: The ingredients used in the Laddu making are also of good quality, says the Srisailam temple management after refusing reports of contamination.

title: Three militants arrested in Manipur
content: Bomb disposal team safely neutralised a 51mm ILLG bomb, which was found planted at Terakhongshangbi Maning Laithel in Bishnupur district.

title: Tribals in Great Nicobar not against development but lack info about mega project: NCST member
content: The project, titled Holistic Development of Great Nicobar, involves the construction of a transshipment port, an international airport, a township and a power plant over more than 160 sq. km of land.

title: Amarnath Yatra 2025: Police in Jammu intensify security
content: The 38-day annual pilgrimage is scheduled to start from the twin routes — the traditional 48-km Pahalgam route in Anantnag district and the shorter but steeper 14-km Baltal route in Ganderbal district

title: Day after stampede, thousands make beeline to have glimpse of sibling deities in Puri
content: At least three persons, including two women, were killed and around 50 others injured in a stampede near Shree Gundicha temple in Puri on June 29, 2025.

title: Why is the ECI de-listing political parties? | Explained
content: What are the requirements for registering a political party with the Election Commission of India? What are the benefits enjoyed by Registered Unrecognised Political Parties? Does the Election Commission have explicit power to de-register a political party?

title: AAP suspends Amritsar North MLA Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh from party for five years
content: AAP spokesperson Neel Garg said the MLA was suspended for consistently making public statements against party activities, and it is against political decorum

title: Probe into Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad looking at all angles: MoS Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol
content: The Minister added that until the investigation report is published, it would be premature to comment on the cause

title: Row over Defence attaché’s remarks on “fighter jets lost” in Operation Sindoor; Indian Embassy steps in
content: The Indian defence attaché said in view of some "constraints" owing to the mandate decided by the "political leadership", the Indian Air Force could not attack Pakistani military installations in the initial phase operation

title: Railway Ministry enhances passengers waiting list cap from 25 to 60% for AC classes
content: The new circular stated that this waiting list limit shall, however, not be applicable to the tickets issued on concessional fares, warrants etc

title: Lord Jagannath, siblings enter aunt’s house at Shree Gundicha Temple
content: According to mythology, Gundicha Temple is the place where the wooden idols of the sibling deities were constructed by Lord Viswakarma

title: 24-year-old Indian woman who went to U.S. for arranged marriage goes missing
content: Simran arrived on a flight from India on June 20. Surveillance footage shows the woman looking at her phone and seemingly waiting for someone, police said.

title: Murder accused highway robber killed in police encounter in UP's Baghpat
content: Sandeep, a resident of Haryana's Rohtak, was wounded in the encounter and later succumbed to his injuries, police said.

title: No meat, eggs or school uniforms in Telangana Gurukuls
content: Contractors and suppliers of these essentials are vexed as their payments are pending for several months

title: Golconda fort turns into sea of devotion, tradition for Bonalu
content: Bonams, or earthen pots containing cooked rice, jaggery, curd and other offerings balanced on the heads of women, formed a striking sight against the backdrop of the ancient fort

title: Revitalised Blue Flag beach at Marina to be launched in second week of July
content: Environment and Forest officials inspect Marina beach on Saturday and advise GCC to revitalise the city beaches, re-establishing degraded native coastal vegetation with ecofriendly infrastructure

title: T.N. set to begin land acquisition process for Parandur airport project
content: In a G.O. issued on June 25, the government directed that the process be initiated; in 2023, it gave sanction to acquire 1,527.32 hectares of patta lands in Sriperumbudur and Kancheepuram taluks

title: Pro-Schedule Castes organisations and activists allege foul play in death of man in Tiruppur district
content: He was found hanging from a tree with his hands tied near Dharapuram. The police suspect it to be a case of suicide, and the victim’s family also did not raise any suspicion over the death

title: 52 villages adjoining LAC, LoC in Ladakh to be reserved areas
content: As per Ladakh administration’s notification, this will enable residents of these identified areas to avail reservation benefits as specified in the amended Ladakh Reservation Rules

title: Sources: Ayton to become free agent after buyout
content: Deandre Ayton is finalizing a contract buyout with the Portland Trail Blazers to become a free agent, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Rockets' Smith to sign $122M extension
content: Rockets forward Jabari Smith Jr. intends to sign a five-year, $122 million rookie contract extension, sources told ESPN.

title: Bailey 'blessed' to be with Jazz: 'Trust my process'
content: Ace Bailey indicated Sunday that he never thought about holding out or forcing a trade after the Jazz drafted him No. 5.

title: Sources: Harden to sign $81.5M deal with Clips
content: James Harden is declining his $36.3 million player option and intends to sign a two-year, $81.5 million contract to return to the Clippers, sources told ESPN.

title: BYU QB Retzlaff intends to transfer, sources say
content: Jake Retzlaff, who is facing a suspension after admitting to premarital sex during his response to a lawsuit alleging he raped a woman, is planning to transfer, sources said.

title: Freese saves 3 in USMNT win: 'Penalties my thing'
content: United States goalkeeper Matthew Freese said he was well prepared and studied up on penalties after providing three saves in a dramatic 4-3 shootout victory over Costa Rica in Sunday's Gold Cup quarterfinal.

title: Source: Knights clear space, deal Hague to Preds
content: The Vegas Golden Knights, perhaps opening cap room to take a run at Mitch Marner, dealt defenseman Nicolas Hague to the Nashville Predators on Sunday, in exchange for blueliner Jeremy Lauzon and center Colton Sissons, a source confirmed.

title: Sky's Reese sets WNBA rebound mark in victory
content: The Sky's Angel Reese scored a season-high 24 points and became the first WNBA player with 15 or more rebounds in four straight games in a 92-85 win over the Sparks on Sunday.

title: Experts weigh in: Can Alcaraz and Gauff win another major? What about Djokovic?
content: Just three weeks after the last Grand Slam, Wimbledon begins on Monday. Our experts answer these questions and more.

title: Freese saves the day as USMNT grinds out another Gold Cup victory
content: It wasn't pretty, but USMNT has marched into the Gold Cup semifinals thanks to Matt Freese's heroics in goal.

title: Is Jake Paul ready for a world title fight? Who is his best option?
content: Following his victory over Julio Cesar Chavez Jr., Jake Paul called out the cruiserweight champs. But can he get them in the ring?

title: Not even Messi can bridge gap between UCL champs PSG and MLS' Inter Miami
content: At times, Lionel Messi has singlehandedly carried Inter Miami to victory. Against the European champions PSG, the Herons needed more than that.

title: PSG rout ends CWC run for Inter Miami, Messi
content: Joao Neves scored twice as Paris Saint-Germain swept aside Lionel Messi's Inter Miami CF 4-0 at Atlanta's Mercedes-Benz Stadium on Sunday to secure their place in the Club World Cup quarterfinals with ruthless efficiency.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree $82M deal for João Pedro
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth a total of £60 million for Brighton striker Joao Pedro, sources have told ESPN.

title: Messi: Miami 'left a good image' despite CWC exit
content: Inter Miami CF left-back Jordi Alba said the team lived up to the expectations of the Club World Cup despite falling 4-0 to Paris Saint-Germain in the round of 16 to be eliminated from the competition.

title: England rout Jamaica 7-0 in Euro 2025 send-off
content: England eased past Jamaica 7-0 on Sunday to give themselves a winning send off as they head to Switzerland for Euro 2025 looking to defend their crown.

title: 'It's a joke': Maresca slams CWC weather delays
content: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca questioned the choice of the U.S. as host of the Club World Cup and branded the two-hour weather delay in his team's win over Benfica as "a joke."

title: Mexico into Gold Cup semis as Mora makes history
content: Alexis Vega scored the crucial opening goal early in the second half to help Mexico to a 2-0 win over Saudi Arabia in the Gold Cup quarterfinals.

title: Bonmati out of hospital; to rejoin Spain squad
content: Spain striker Aitana Bonmatí has been discharged from hospital after recovering from viral meningitis and will re-join the squad in the coming days.

title: Sources: Chelsea agree to sign Gittens; 7-yr deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal worth up to €65 million ($76.1m) to sign Jamie Gittens from Borussia Dortmund, sources have told ESPN.

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: A weird, wonderful night with Ryans, the Rockies and an unlikely world-record attempt
content: What happens when hundreds of Ryans -- no Bryans allowed! -- descend on Coors Field in the hopes of making history? Delightful chaos.﻿

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up
content: Two AL hitters are crushing long balls at a historic rate. Before their 81st games, we compare their first-half performances to the best ever -- and whether they can keep it going.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: Early 2026 NBA mock draft: Meet the four contenders for the No. 1 pick
content: There's considerable excitement around next year's draft class thanks to four players vying for the top spot.

title: Pep: CWC 'not ideal,' but other clubs are jealous
content: Pep Guardiola has accepted that participation in the FIFA Club World Cup could "destroy" Manchester City's season but has hinted that other clubs not in the tournament are jealous they are not taking part.

title: Guatemala dumps Canada in Gold Cup shootout
content: Jose Morales buried the winner in the seventh round of penalty kicks to propel Guatemala over Canada and into the semifinals of the Concacaf Gold Cup on Sunday in Minneapolis.

title: Only terrible agent can stop Gyökeres exit - chief
content: Sporting CP president Frederico Varandas has admitted that Viktor Gyökeres is likely to leave the club this summer.

title: Flamengo coach: 'Fact' Europe has 'better players'
content: Flamengo coach Filipe Luis said it was a "fact" the football elite remained in Europe after the Brazilian side were beaten 4-2 in a last-16 clash against Bayern Munich at the Club World Cup on Sunday.

title: 24 in 24: Rodriguez nets in another USWNT debut
content: Defender Izzy Rodriguez and midfielder Sam Meza were the two latest players to wear the USWNT shirt in a match for the first time under Hayes and Rodriguez scored.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man Utd eye Kean if Mbeumo deal fails
content: Manchester United will need to move fast if they want to sign Moise Kean from Fiorentina. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Liverpool turn to Hato
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: S. Korean duo win Dow, deny Thompson title
content: Somi Lee poured in an 8-foot birdie putt on the first playoff hole to team with fellow South Korean Jin Hee Im to win the Dow Championship on Sunday, denying Lexi Thompson her first LPGA title in six years.

title: One-of-one and autographed rookie Carlos Alcaraz card sells for record $237,907
content: The previous record belonged to an Alcaraz 1-of-1 2024 Topps Royalty Racket Knob Autograph Relic Card.

title: Trump says won't extend July 9 tariff deadline; India's trade team extends US stay
content: President Trump indicated he won't extend the tariff pause beyond July 9, even as India's delegation extended its stay in Washington to negotiate a trade deal. India seeks exemption from additional tariffs, while the US presses for market access in agriculture and other sectors.

title: 'Namazvad, not Samajwad': BJP on Tejashwi's 'will bin Waqf Act' remark
content: Bharatiya Janata Party criticizes Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav. Yadav promised to discard the Waqf Act if his alliance wins Bihar elections. BJP accuses Yadav of vote bank politics. They also criticize the INDIA bloc for disregarding the Constitution. BJP questions if the INDIA alliance plans to implement Sharia law in Bihar.

title: IAF lost jets over ‘political call’, says def attache; quoted out of context: Govt
content: India's defence attache to Indonesia, Captain Shiv Kumar, revealed that the IAF suffered losses during the May 7 strikes in Pakistan and PoK due to political constraints against targeting military establishments. This followed CDS General Chauhan's acknowledgment of initial losses. While Pakistan claimed to have downed six Indian fighters, the government is yet to quantify the losses.

title: Watch: 5-storey building collapses in Shimla; no casualties reported
content: A five-storey building in Shimla's Mathu Colony, near Chamyana Super Specialty Hospital, collapsed due to incessant rain. Videos circulating on social media captured the rapid collapse of the structure. Fortunately, the building was vacant, and no casualties were reported. The meteorological department has issued a red alert for Himachal Pradesh for the next three days.

title: OpenAI CEO takes one of the biggest AI U-Turn; says: Current computers are …
content: Sam Altman has shifted his stance on AI hardware, now believing new devices are essential as AI evolves, contrasting his previous view. He envisions AI systems deeply integrated into users' lives, moving beyond traditional interfaces. This change aligns with Jony Ive's arrival at OpenAI, sparking speculation about a groundbreaking AI device slated for release in late 2026.

title: ‘From Rs 600 a day to Team India’: Varun Chakaravarthy's inspiring story
content: Varun Chakaravarthy, the Indian cricketer, revealed his diverse career path before cricket success, including architecture, music, and filmmaking. He transitioned from an assistant architect earning ₹14,000 to ₹18,000 monthly to exploring music and facing entrepreneurial challenges.

title: Denied visa, Pak couple crosses border for new life; perishes in Thar desert
content: A Pakistani couple, Ravi Kumar and Shanti Bai, who crossed the international border near Jaisalmer, tragically died of thirst and dehydration. Their bodies were discovered with an empty jerry can, highlighting their desperate struggle. Despite visa rejections and warnings, they sought a better life in India, leading them to cross illegally and become lost in the desert.

title: 'Everybody's shot': Chilling audio of Idaho shooting reveals chaos
content: An active shooter attacked emergency responders near Canfield Mountain in northern Idaho, resulting in the deaths of two firefighters. The incident unfolded after crews arrived at a fire scene, prompting a massive police operation to locate the still-active shooter. Authorities are urging caution as the situation remains ongoing, with officials describing it as a dire and dangerous event.

title: SoftBank founder’s prediction: Bets billions on AI company; says it will be world's most valuable
content: SoftBank is heavily investing in OpenAI, with planned investments of $33.2 billion, as CEO Masayoshi Son envisions OpenAI becoming the world's most valuable company and a leader in artificial superintelligence. Despite Microsoft's changing relationship with OpenAI, SoftBank remains committed to supporting the AI firm's growth and its role in SoftBank's vision for the future.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Disappointed' - Ex-India cricketer questions ECB’s move
content: Farokh Engineer, a close friend of Mansur Ali Khan Pataudi, criticized the ECB's initial decision to rename the India-England Test series trophy, feeling the subsequent introduction of a winning captain's medal named after the Pataudi family was merely an afterthought.

title: Karnataka PUC 2 exam 3 result: When & how to check KSEAB 12th supply scores
content: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board (KSEAB) will soon announce the 2nd PUC Exam 3 results for students who took the third and final attempt this academic year. Held from June 9 to 21, 2025, this exam helps students who failed or wished to improve scores. Results will be available at karresults.nic.in.

title: Ship on fire in Gulf of Oman: INS Tabar rescues crew; op still on
content: An Indian Naval ship, deployed in the Gulf of Oman, swiftly responded to a distress call from MT Yi Cheng 6, a Palau-flagged vessel with 14 Indian crew members. The ship experienced a major engine room fire and power failure while traveling from Kandla, India, to Shinas, Oman.

title: AI talent wars: Ex-OpenAI researcher joins Zuckerberg’s SuperIntelligence
content: Lucas Beyer, a recent Meta hire from OpenAI, refuted claims of a $100 million signing bonus, dismissing them as "fake news." This follows Sam Altman's suggestion of Meta's extravagant offers to lure talent. Meta's CTO criticized Altman's tactics as dishonest, highlighting the ongoing talent war and Meta's significant AI investments.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for June 30 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices experienced a slight decline due to easing geopolitical tensions and reduced demand for safe-haven assets, although a weaker US dollar limited further losses. Market participants are closely monitoring Federal Reserve's rate path and any potential escalation in geopolitical risks. Experts predict a sideways to lower trend for gold, with a broad range of 93,500-96,500.

title: 'Warlords': Iran's top clerics issue 'fatwa' against Trump, Netanyahu
content: A top Iranian cleric, Grand Ayatollah Shirazi, has issued a fatwa against Trump and Netanyahu, urging global Muslim action. This follows a reported 12-day conflict where US and Israeli operations significantly damaged Iran's nuclear sites, leading to retaliatory missile strikes.

title: Techie locks self in Navi Mumbai flat for 3 years; how did he survive?
content: In Navi Mumbai, Anup Kumar Nair, a 55-year-old man, battled severe loneliness and depression, isolating himself in his flat for three years, relying solely on online food orders. Following a concerned tip, SEAL social workers intervened, discovering Nair in dire conditions, suffering from a leg infection and profound distrust after the loss of his family

title: 'Break legs': Bhubaneswar cop's order against protesters sparks row
content: A controversy erupted in Bhubaneswar after Additional Police Commissioner Narasingha Bhol was recorded instructing officers to 'break legs' of Congress protestors demonstrating near Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi's residence regarding the Puri stampede. Bhol allegedly offered rewards for such actions, sparking strong condemnation from Congress leaders like Yashir Nawaz, who claimed they were holding a peaceful rally.

title: No stretcher at Bijnor CHC: Injured sanitation worker made to lie on floor for X-ray
content: A sanitation worker in Bijnor, Ranjeet Kumar, was allegedly forced to lie on the floor for an X-ray at Kiratpur Community Health Centre after a garbage van overturned on him. The incident, captured in a video, sparked public outrage and prompted a probe by District Magistrate Jasjit Kaur.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down 100 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Monday. While Nifty50 was near 25,600, BSE Sensex was down 100 points.

title: No space for GOP moderates in Trump era? What Tillis's exit reveals
content: Senator Thom Tillis announced his retirement in 2026 after voting against Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill,' highlighting the increasing difficulty for moderate Republicans. Trump celebrated Tillis's departure, signaling a tightening grip on the GOP. With moderates retreating, the party faces a transformation, potentially limiting bipartisanship and independent thinking in the Senate.

title: Railways' three big steps for ticketing! New charting, Tatkal & more- Details
content: Indian Railways is set to introduce significant changes to its passenger reservation system, aiming to enhance passenger comfort. Key improvements include preparing reservation charts eight hours in advance, implementing verified user-only Tatkal ticket bookings with OTP authentication by July 2025, and launching a new passenger reservation system by December 2025.

title: 'Ek hi format se liya h bas': Jadeja’s reply as teammates tease him at WC anniversary party - Watch
content: Team India celebrated the one-year anniversary of their 2024 T20 World Cup victory in Birmingham, taking a break from Test match preparations. A video shared by the BCCI captured the team cutting a cake and reminiscing about their unbeaten run to the title. The players, including Bumrah, Pant and Jadeja, shared light-hearted moments and laughter, celebrating the unforgettable triumph.

title: 'Like absolute butter': Trump on US bombing Iranian nuke facilities
content: President Trump declared American airstrikes had obliterated Iran's nuclear ambitions, particularly at the Fordo facility, dismissing doubts about the strikes' effectiveness and intelligence leaks. He asserted Iran was close to nuclear weapon acquisition before the strikes crippled their program. Trump also hinted at expanding the Abraham Accords with more Arab nations.

title: Idaho shooting: 2 killed as sniper targets firefighters
content: In Idaho, a sniper ambush targeted firefighters battling a blaze on Canfield Mountain, resulting in the deaths of at least two individuals believed to be firefighters. The lone shooter was found dead, and authorities have stated that there is no further threat to the community. Governor Brad Little condemned the attack, urging prayers for the victims and their families.

title: Amarnath Yatra from July 3: Mock drills held at Yatri Niwas base camp
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir are preparing for the Amarnath Yatra. A mock drill was conducted at Yatri Niwas. This drill tested emergency response for potential disasters. The first pilgrim batch will leave Jammu on July 2. Authorities are ensuring all facilities are ready. Security measures include increased surveillance and highway patrols.

title: Jasmin Brown glows in third trimester; expecting second baby with Cam Newton
content: Jasmin Brown, expecting her second child with Cam Newton, shares glimpses of her pregnancy journey with fans. She balances her public persona with a desire for privacy, keeping details about her family life under wraps. As her due date approaches, Jasmin continues to inspire with her positive outlook and authentic celebration of motherhood.

title: 'Have to get re-elected': Trump's veiled warning to Republicans amid big bill debate
content: US Senate is currently engaged in discussions regarding President Donald Trump's 'Big Beautiful bill'. Republican leaders are aiming for approval by July 4. The bill includes significant tax reductions and cuts to Medicaid and food stamps. Concerns arise over potential insurance coverage loss for millions of Americans. The House Speaker Mike Johnson is preparing for a possible vote next week.

title: Trade talks: Canada buckles under Trump pressure, revokes 'digital tax'
content: Trade talks between Canada and the United States have been revived after Canada agreed to rescind its planned tax on American technology firms. This decision followed President Trump's suspension of negotiations in response to the digital services tax, which he viewed as an attack on the US. Both countries aim to reach a trade agreement by July 21, 2025.

title: Cops fled to save themselves: Puri stampede eyewitnesses, survivors
content: A stampede at Gundicha Temple in Puri led to three deaths. Survivors accuse the police of prioritizing their safety over rescuing devotees. Eyewitnesses report inadequate crowd control measures. They mention trucks obstructing the area and slippery logs contributing to the chaos. A resident highlights the recurring failure in managing large crowds during festivals. The incident raises concerns about safety protocols.

title: 'Out’ with the old: Wimbledon embraces ELC, retires line judges after 148 years
content: Wimbledon 2025 marks the end of an era as line judges are permanently replaced by Electronic Line Calling (ELC), joining the US and Australian Opens. Once a signature sight with their sharp attire and stoic presence, line judges will now serve as “match assistants” and a shortened bunch will be on standby should the technology hit a snag.

title: 'He got little upset': Trump downplays Musk's outbursts on 'big bill'
content: Donald Trump and Elon Musk are clashing again over a Senate bill Musk calls a job-destroying "abomination." Trump acknowledged Musk's past support but criticized his recent behavior, including a tweet linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. Trump attributed Musk's anger to concerns about electric vehicle mandates, stating he doesn't want everyone forced to drive electric cars.

title: 'Intercepted intel' again questions impact of US strikes on Iran nuke sites
content: Intercepted Iranian communications suggest minimal damage to nuclear facilities following US military action, casting doubt on claims of complete obliteration. A leaked preliminary assessment indicates the strikes might only cause months of setback. Despite President Trump's assertion of total destruction, the White House maintains the Iranian nuclear weapons program is over, contesting reports of limited impact.

title: 'Babu Rao’ back: Paresh Rawal confirms Hera Pheri 3; says row with Akshay resolved
content: Paresh Rawal is officially back as Babu Bhaiya in Hera Pheri 3, resolving previous disputes and reuniting the beloved trio. He emphasized the importance of respecting the audience's love for the franchise and delivering a worthwhile film. With all issues settled, the team is focused on working together to create a hilarious and nostalgic blockbuster for the big screen.

title: IND vs ENG: ‘Chosen twice’ – Rishabh Pant shares emotional message
content: Rishabh Pant reflected on his journey, a year after India's T20 World Cup victory, acknowledging his second chance at life following a severe accident. Despite a duck in the final against South Africa, Pant's strategic pause in play, feigning knee pain, disrupted South Africa's momentum, a move Rohit Sharma initially believed was genuine concern for Pant's well-being.

title: 64.3% of population under social security net, up from 22% in 2016: Govt report
content: India has made substantial strides in social protection, expanding coverage from 22% in 2016 to 64.3% in 2025. Poverty has declined significantly, with a notable reduction in extreme poverty rates.

title: 'Body language says...': Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce’s NYC date decoded
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce recently captured attention in Manhattan. Their coordinated style and affection suggest a deep connection. Body language expert Judi James notes their 'prom-queen and king' aesthetic. Travis Kelce's style seems to mirror Swift's. His gestures indicate he takes the relationship seriously. Their body language suggests a couple in the early stages of romance.

title: Post Op Sindoor, India to fast-track launch of 52 defence surveillance satellites
content: India is accelerating its space surveillance capabilities following Operation Sindoor, planning to launch 52 dedicated military satellites by 2029, with the first launch expected next April. This initiative, costing Rs 26,968 crore, aims to enhance surveillance of China, Pakistan, and the Indian Ocean Region. The move is also a response to China's growing space capabilities and military advancements in space.

title: 'Kannappa' Box Office: Vishnu Manchu's film crosses Rs 23 crore in opening weekend
content: Vishnu Manchu's mythological film 'Kannappa' has enjoyed a successful opening weekend, grossing approximately Rs 23.75 crore in India. The Telugu version led in occupancy, while Tamil and Hindi versions also performed moderately well. The film, directed by Mukesh Kumar Singh, features star-studded cameos and has received mixed but generally positive reviews, marking a career-best opening for Vishnu Manchu.

title: AI 171 crash probe looking at sabotage angle too: Minister
content: The investigation into the Air India AI 171 crash in Ahmedabad on June 12 is exploring all possibilities, including sabotage, according to Junior Civil Aviation Minister Murlidhar Mohol. The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is analyzing the black box data, recovered CVR and FDR, to determine the cause of the accident.

title: 4 days after Kolkata rape, cops seize hockey stick, clothing of suspects; collect DNA
content: Kolkata Police's SIT swiftly investigates the alleged gang-rape of a law student, collecting crucial DNA evidence and seizing clothing from the suspects' homes. CCTV footage corroborates the survivor's account, showing her being dragged back to the guard room.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ Box Office: Film soars past Rs 120 crore
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' a sports drama directed by R.S. Prasanna, is a box office hit, earning Rs 122.65 crore in ten days. The film received praise from Shashi Tharoor and President Droupadi Murmu at special screenings. It tells the heartwarming story of a basketball coach training players with special needs, starring Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza.

title: Inquiry into Puri Rath Yatra stampede to be completed in 30 days: Odisha Minister
content: Prithviraj Harichandan said that Development Commissioner Anu Garg will submit her inquiry report to the Chief Minister within the stipulated 30 days

title: People hit streets in Kolkata, add intensity to protests over law college gang rape
content: Medico-legal examination and recording of the statement by the survivor have been completed; Kolkata Police expand number of officers in the SIT formed to probe the crime

title: Security forces seize huge quantity of explosives in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharswan
content: The explosives, including 500 electronic detonators, were seized from a Maoist dump set up in Gobargota forest near Raijama village, a statement issued by Superintendent of Police Mukesh Kumar Lunayat said

title: Pakistan national apprehended along LoC in J&K
content: The Army officials are presently questioning the Pakistani national, identified as Mohammad Arib Ahmed, the son of Mohd Yousaf, a resident of Detote in Nikiyal Tehsil of Kotli district

title: Six policemen placed under suspension over the death of a temple security guard in Sivaganga
content: Ajith Kumar, a security guard at the famous Madapuram  Badrakaliamman Temple near Tirupuvanam, died following his “custodial interrogation” in a theft case on Saturday

title: Delhi-bound Air India flight from Tokyo's Haneda Airport diverted to Kolkata
content: "Air India flight AI357 operating from Haneda to Delhi on June 29 made a precautionary diversion to Kolkata due to persistent warm temperature experienced in the cabin," Air India said.

title: Congress targets Centre over Indian defence attache’s remarks on ‘loss of fighter jets’ during Operation Sindoor
content: Party leaders accuse Modi government of misleading people, question Prime Minister’s refusal to take Opposition into confidence

title: At Nitish’s turf, Chirag says Opposition leaders fear his arrival in Bihar
content: As long as ‘Chirag Paswan is alive’, there will be no threat to reservation, he says; LJP (RV) leader further takes dig at RJD, says they are allied with the party that imposed Emergency; promises he will have a ‘Bihar First-Bihari First’ policy

title: Reservation chart set to be prepared eight hours prior to departure of train
content: New PRS, which is being developed, will allow over 1.5 lakh ticket bookings per minute, says official

title: Remarks of Trinamool leaders on law college rape put party in a tight spot
content: The remarks by senior party MP Kalyan Banerjee and MLA Madan Mitra on the gang rape of a student at South Calcutta Law College has come as an embarrassment to the party

title: Airlines not reporting unruly behaviour of passengers, says DGCA
content: The aviation regulator reiterates the rule to submit to it a detailed report on such incidents within 24 hours of landing

title: AI will enable police to render quick services and check crime, says A.P. DGP
content: IPS officers, AI experts, startup companies, researchers and students discuss on tracking criminals, monitoring data, preventing cybercrimes, online frauds and detecting cases during the three-day ‘AI4AndhraPolice’ hackathon

title: DMK will secure majority, there will be no coalition government: Vaiko
content: Speaking to reporters in Chennai, he says the MDMK will work hard to ensure victory for the DMK and its alliance partners

title: Rewari village shuns family of Indian Navy staffer arrested for alleged spying
content: A decision was taken at a meeting to ostracise the family for ‘bringing a bad name to the village’, Sarpanch Satyalpal Yadav of Punsika village in Haryana told media persons

title: Kerala to seek sterilisation of Bonnet macaque near forests
content: The Kerala Forest Department had drawn up a ‘Mission Bonnet macaque’ as part of a 10-point programme to reduce instances of human-wildlife conflicts

title: Turmeric Board will strengthen farmers financially with new markets opening: Amit Shah
content: Farmers will no longer have to rely on middlemen as the Board will establish the entire value chain — packaging, branding, marketing and export, the Home Minister said

title: ACB suspects ‘clandestine code system’ by mediators at RTA office
content: The officials stumbled upon some markings on the applications which on investigation were found to be a code to identify the agent sending the application

title: Munnar church takes Hindi route as migrant workers flock to Mass
content: Hindi Mass to be held on the last Sunday of every month at Mount Carmel Basilica. Increasing number of Hindi-speaking migrant workers in plantation sector leads to decision. Through a Mass in their own language, we hope the faithful can fulfil their spiritual needs, says Church

title: What's ahead in 2025 for Notre Dame, UConn and the Pac-2?
content: Could the Irish make another CFP run? Could UConn build on a breakthrough season? We break down what 2025 looks like.

title: Wetzel: Please don't expand NCAA basketball tournaments
content: The NCAA will risk an iconic slice of Americana if it expands the NCAA men's and women's tournaments again.

title: Complete draft order of picks for every round
content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: How Wiegman's 'new England' have evolved ahead of Euro 2025
content: England won Euro 2022 but have undergone some changes in the three years since. How are they looking ahead of their title defense?

title: State check: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 1 quiz
content: How well do you know your state sports trivia? From D.C. to Alabama, we're putting your knowledge to the test.

title: Disgruntlement among Congress legislators aggravates ahead of Surjewala’s visit to Bengaluru
content: Party sources said Mr. Surjewala would be in Bengaluru for two days and is scheduled to meet with some legislators to elicit their opinions on the functioning of the government and discuss the problem of the release of funds to constituencies.

title: Adarsh Saji elected SFI president, Srijan Bhattacharya is general secretary
content: The Students Federation of India also elected an 87-member central executive committee during its ongoing four-day national conference

title: Kerala Cabinet to decide on new State Police Chief on Monday
content: The race for the top position is reportedly tipped in favour of Ravada A. Chandrasekhar. Nitin Agrawal and Yogesh Gupta too on the list recommended by the UPSC

title: CHOs continue to wait for government response on resolution of demands
content: Stopping work, the CHOs had launched a Statewide protest on April 24 that continued for around 40 days

title: Kerala govt. firm on Zumba in schools, seeks an end to controversy
content: Several Muslim organisations seek to moderate the controversy in larger civic interest. SNDP Yogam backs government, BJP questions the wisdom of introducing the dance form in schools. Sivankutty says students are free to choose not to attend Zumba classes.  Youth Congress, SFI, and DYFI denounce move to impose religious considerations on sports and art forms

title: Speculation on leadership change in Karnataka surfaces again
content: While Ramanagara MLA predicts DKS may become CM in next two to three months, Minister H.C. Mahadevappa says Siddaramaiah will complete full term

title: Farmers in Kandukur intensify protest against Andhra Pradesh government’s plan to acquire 8,300 acres for solar project
content: Kandukur Sub-Collector visits the spot and promises to submit a report to the government on the ground situation

title: Mumbai's Historic 'Jimmy Boy' Parsi Eatery Closes Due To Safety Concerns
content: Jimmy Boy has long been a culinary icon in South Mumbai, known for its Keema Pav, Berry Pulao, Dhansak, Mava Cakes, Brun Maska, and vintage Irani tea.

title: 3 Sibilings Drown While Bathing In Pond In Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur
content: Three minor siblings have drowned while bathing in a pond in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur district, police said.

title: Indian Navy Comes To Aid Of Oman-Bound Vessel On Fire, Indian Crew Onboard
content: Pulau flagged MT Yi Cheng 6 was going from Kandla in Gujarat to Shinas, Oman when it made a distress call on Sunday.

title: J&K Security Forces Conduct Mock Drill Ahead Of Amarnath Yatra 2025
content: Security forces on Monday carried out an extensive joint mock drill along the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway, as part of final preparations ahead of the annual Amarnath Yatra 2025.

title: Severe Heat Waves Hit Southern Europe, Greece On High Wildfire Alert
content: Major heat waves across Southern Europe have pushed temperatures above 40 C (104 F) in countries including Italy, Spain and Greece, as local authorities issued fresh warnings against the risk of wildfires.

title: 4 Of A Family Killed After Car Gets Hit By Speeding Truck In Karnataka
content: In a tragic road accident on National Highway 75 near the Kunigal bypass in Karnataka's Tumakuru district, four members of the same family lost their lives after the car they were travelling in was hit by a speeding canter truck.

title: 24-Hour Ban On Char Dham Yatra Lifted: Officials
content: The 24-hour ban on Char Dham Yatra was lifted on Monday. This comes after the Char Dham Yatra was suspended on Sunday following a heavy rain alert, as per officials.

title: Custodial Death Sparks Outrage In Agartala, Family Alleges Police Assault
content: Kailash Roy reportedly died in Bishalgarh Central Jail on Sunday, around 11 days after he and his son were taken into custody for allegedly obstructing a court staff.

title: Trump Says US Doesn't Plan To Extend Tariff Pause, Would Rather Do This
content: US President Donald Trump has indicated that he is not planning to extend a 90-day pause on tariffs on most nations beyond the July 9 deadline, when the negotiating period he previously set would expire.

title: Tamil Nadu Guard Dies Allegedly In Police Custody, Opposition Demands Probe
content: A 28-year-old security guard of a temple in Sivaganga district allegedly died when he was being questioned by police in connection with a theft case.

title: Stars, Stripes, Tricolour: Can India, US Align In Orbit In PM Modi-Trump Space Summit?
content: Astronauts from India and the United States are currently working side by side aboard the International Space Station (ISS), marking a significant milestone in global space collaboration.

title: Adani Group Becomes India's Fastest-Growing Brand With Focus On Green Energy
content: Adani Group's growth is attributed to aggressive and integrated infrastructure focus, surge in green energy ambitions, and increased brand equity across key stakeholders.

title: Netanyahu's Trial Hearings Cancelled Amid Trump's "Let Bibi Go" Post
content: The Jerusalem District Court cancelled this week's hearings in Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's long-running corruption trial, accepting a request the Israeli leader made citing classified diplomatic and security grounds.

title: Trump Praises "Wonderful Guy" Musk Amid Feud Over "Big, Beautiful Bill"
content: Amid his ongoing feud with Elon Musk over the "big beautiful bill, US President Donald Trump has praised his wayward billionaire wingman, calling him a "wonderful guy".

title: US Canada Resume Trade Talks Days After Trump Ended It Over Tax On Tech Firms
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said late Sunday trade talks with US have resumed after Canada rescinded its plan to tax US technology firms.

title: Delhi Man Stabs Son, 10, To Death After Argument Over Playing In Rain
content: A 10-year-old boy was allegedly stabbed to death by his father on Sunday afternoon following a dispute over playing in the rain in Sagarpur area of southwest Delhi, police said.

title: After War With Iran, Netanyahu Sees 'Opportunities' To Rescue Gaza Hostages
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Sunday the 12-day war with Iran had created opportunities for Israel, and the first was the return of hostages held in Gaza by Palestinian militants who attacked Israel on October 7, 2023.

title: "Break Their Legs": Odisha Police Officer's Instruction At Protest Goes Viral. "Out Of Context," He Says
content: A senior police officer's very specific instruction to police personnel guarding a barbed wire barricade outside Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi's house during a protest by Congress party workers has gone viral on social media.

title: "Have A Buyer For TikTok," Says Trump But He Won't Divulge Name
content: President Donald Trump said he has identified a buyer for the US operations of TikTok, the social media app owned by Chinese company ByteDance Ltd., but he won't provide details for two weeks.
